content: loop and 3rd loop around 132 single_crochet see photo 1 row 15 to where handles are formed do not attach to first single_crochet with a slip_stitch but continue in single_crochet s around till work measures about 25 cm ± 10 inches you can place a stitch marker in the first stitch of row 15 and move the marker up as you go along to keep track of where the row starts and ends but i just went along till it did not appear to askew at the top to form handles mark your beginning single_crochet with a stitch marker it is important to place your marker this time photo 3 photo 4 46 single_crochet chain 20 skip 20 single_crochet see photo 3 46 single_crochet chain 20 skip 20 single_crochet this is the end of the row you should now be where you placed your stitch at the beginning of the row do not attach with a slip_stitch to single_crochet but continue with single_crochet around you make 20 single_crochet in the 20 chain spaces you made in the previous round see photo 4 until the handles measure about 5 cm ± 2 inches total measurement of the bag body with handles is ± 30 cm ± 12 inches you can end with a row of crab stitch if you wish but it is not necessary cut thread and work in all ends you can embellish your basket/bag with crochet flowers buttons or use your enamel pins to make it your own enjoy using your yarn bag please let me know should you find any errors in this pattern excellent project to use odd bits of leftover yarn you can also use a heavier weight yarn to get a bigger bag or thinner yarn or cotton to get a smaller bag remember to use a crochet hook to match your yarn ©teresa jansen van vuuren 2018 for personal use only pattern may not be sold copied reproduced or shared online
